algorithm:
New algorithm description:

In the new algorithm, we modify the scoring function by assigning scores to bins based on their remaining capacity divided by the square root of the item size. Bins with remaining capacity closer to the item size will receive higher scores, while bins with larger or smaller remaining capacities will receive lower scores. The final scores for the bins are normalized to ensure they sum up to 1.

New algorithm implementation:

```
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    num_bins = len(bins)
    
    # Calculate differences between remaining capacity and item size
    diff = np.abs(bins - item)
    
    # Calculate scores based on the inverse of differences divided by the square root of the item size
    scores = 1 / (diff / np.sqrt(item))
    
    # Adjust scores to ensure they sum up to 1
    scores = scores / np.sum(scores)
    
    return scores
